articles.description: Google co-founders, Larry Page and Sergey Brin, used Burning Man to find former CEO, Eric Schmidt. According to performance expert Steven Kotler, Google relies on creating group-flow states. When Page and Brin were looking for a new CEO, Burning Man was the p…
articles.content:
Following is a transcript of the video.
 Google used Burning Man to find a CEO because they were interested in finding a CEO who's familiar with group flow.

articles.title: This 'self-charging' electric car has a dashboard filled with dead moss to clean the air

articles.content:
Sion, an electric car that has solar charging capabilities and island moss for air filtration, has been fully revealed.

articles.title: 25 tactful gifts for your in-laws that'll make a great impression
